content.question: A spring with a relaxed length of <math alttext="L sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is hung vertically from a ceiling. When an object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to the end of the spring and slowly lowered until it reaches equilibrium, the length of the spring is <math alttext="L sub 0, plus delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mo>∆</mo><mi>x</mi></math>. Which of the following indicates the length of the spring if the object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is removed and an object of mass <math alttext="4 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>m</mi></math> is attached to the end of the spring and slowly lowered until it reaches equilibrium?

choices.label: <math alttext="one fourth times open parenthesis, L sub 0, plus delta x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="L sub 0, plus one fourth delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 times open parenthesis, L sub 0, plus delta x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="L sub 0, plus 4 delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="L sub 0, plus 4 delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>x</mi></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
